thread.title: Duterte kakasuhan sa int’l court ng abogado ni Matobato
thread.title_full: Duterte kakasuhan sa int’l court ng abogado ni Matobato

title: Duterte kakasuhan sa int’l court ng abogado ni Matobato

organizations.name: human rights watch and amnesty international

text:
Duterte kakasuhan sa int’l court ng abogado ni Matobato   12:53pm Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte delivers a speech at the Philippine Economic Forum in Tokyo, Wednesday, Oct. 26, 2016. Duterte is on a three-day official visit to Japan. AP Photo/Eugene Hoshiko, file 
MANILA, Philippines — Sapat na ang mga isiniwalat ng mga nagpakilalang miyembro ng Davao Death Squad na sina Edgar Matobato at SPO3 Arthur Lascañas upang makasuhan si Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte, ayon sa isang abogado. 
Kinumpirma ni Jude Sabio na maghahain siya ng kasong crime against humanity sa international criminal court laban kay Duterte kaugnay ng mga aktibidad ng DDS mula pa noong alkalde siya ng Davao City at ang mga patayan sa war on drugs. 
"Their testimonies, which corroborate each other to prove that in Davao City when Duterte was still mayor, it was his policy or strategy to kill suspected criminals in order to control crime," wika ni Sabio sa Philstar.com 
Nakatakdang lumipad patungong The Hague, Netherlands si Sabio sa katapusan ng Marso o sa unang linggo ng Abril upang isampa ang kaso. 
"We are lucky to have reports coming from Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International documenting the cases of extrajudicial killings in the country particularly the Amnesty International stated that there is now an ongoing policy of paying policemen to kill suspected criminals," sabi ni Sabio. 
Magsisilbi ring pangsuporta sa kaso ang mga papeles ng Commission on Human Rights gayun din ang mga affidavit ng mga testigo. PSN ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 
Naniniwala ang abogado na maglalabas ng arrest warrant ang international court laban kay Duterte pagkatapos nilang magsagawa ng imbestigasyon sa extrajudicial killings. 
"We have heard that the prosecutor of the ICC has spoken out saying that that case of the Philippine sis already ripe for a formal investigation," dagdag niya. 
Nakasaad sa 1987 Constitution na hindi maaaring makasuhan ang Pangulo ngunit maaari siyang mapanagot sa international court. 
"In the International Criminal Court, he can be investigated, he can be tried and he can be imprisoned. A warrant of arrest can be issued against him and he's like any other ordinary person who can be arrested."
